001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.cscore;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.PixelFormat;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.RawFrame;
009import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
010import org.opencv.core.CvType;
011import org.opencv.core.Mat;
012
013/**
014 * A sink for user code to accept video frames as OpenCV images. These sinks require the WPILib
015 * OpenCV builds. For an alternate OpenCV, see the documentation how to build your own with RawSink.
016 */
017public class CvSink extends ImageSink {
018  private final RawFrame m_frame = new RawFrame();
019  private Mat m_tmpMat;
020  private ByteBuffer m_origByteBuffer;
021  private int m_width;
022  private int m_height;
023  private PixelFormat m_pixelFormat;
024
025  @Override
026  public void close() {
027    if (m_tmpMat != null) {
028      m_tmpMat.release();
029    }
030    m_frame.close();
031    super.close();
032  }
033
034  private int getCVFormat(PixelFormat pixelFormat) {
035    return switch (pixelFormat) {
036      case kYUYV, kRGB565, kY16, kUYVY -> CvType.CV_8UC2;
037      case kBGR -> CvType.CV_8UC3;
038      case kBGRA -> CvType.CV_8UC4;
039      case kGray, kMJPEG, kUnknown -> CvType.CV_8UC1;
040    };
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Create a sink for accepting OpenCV images. grabFrame() must be called on the created sink to
045   * get each new image.
046   *
047   * @param name Source name (arbitrary unique identifier)
048   * @param pixelFormat Source pixel format
049   */
050  public CvSink(String name, PixelFormat pixelFormat) {
051    super(CameraServerJNI.createRawSink(name, true));
052    m_pixelFormat = pixelFormat;
053    OpenCvLoader.forceStaticLoad();
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Create a sink for accepting OpenCV images. WaitForFrame() must be called on the created sink to
058   * get each new image. Defaults to kBGR for pixelFormat
059   *
060   * @param name Source name (arbitrary unique identifier)
061   */
062  public CvSink(String name) {
063    this(name, PixelFormat.kBGR);
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Wait for the next frame and get the image. Times out (returning 0) after 0.225 seconds. The
068   * provided image will have the pixelFormat this class was constructed with.
069   *
070   * @param image Where to store the image.
071   * @return Frame time, or 0 on error (call GetError() to obtain the error message)
072   */
073  public long grabFrame(Mat image) {
074    return grabFrame(image, 0.225);
075  }
076
077  /**
078   * Wait for the next frame and get the image. Times out (returning 0) after timeout seconds. The
079   * provided image will have the pixelFormat this class was constructed with.
080   *
081   * @param image Where to store the image.
082   * @param timeout Retrieval timeout in seconds.
083   * @return Frame time, or 0 on error (call GetError() to obtain the error message); the frame time
084   *     is in 1 us increments.
085   */
086  public long grabFrame(Mat image, double timeout) {
087    long rv = grabFrameDirect(timeout);
088    if (rv <= 0) {
089      return rv;
090    }
091    m_tmpMat.copyTo(image);
092    return rv;
093  }
094
095  /**
096   * Wait for the next frame and get the image. May block forever. The provided image will have the
097   * pixelFormat this class was constructed with.
098   *
099   * @param image Where to store the image.
100   * @return Frame time, or 0 on error (call GetError() to obtain the error message); the frame time
101   *     is in 1 us increments.
102   */
103  public long grabFrameNoTimeout(Mat image) {
104    long rv = grabFrameNoTimeoutDirect();
105    if (rv <= 0) {
106      return rv;
107    }
108    m_tmpMat.copyTo(image);
109    return rv;
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Get the direct backing mat for this sink.
114   *
115   * <p>This mat can be invalidated any time any of the grab* methods are called, or when the CvSink
116   * is closed.
117   *
118   * @return The backing mat.
119   */
120  public Mat getDirectMat() {
121    return m_tmpMat;
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Wait for the next frame and store the image. Times out (returning 0) after 0.225 seconds. The
126   * provided image will have the pixelFormat this class was constructed with. Use getDirectMat() to
127   * grab the image.
128   *
129   * @return Frame time, or 0 on error (call GetError() to obtain the error message)
130   */
131  public long grabFrameDirect() {
132    return grabFrameDirect(0.225);
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Wait for the next frame and store the image. Times out (returning 0) after timeout seconds. The
137   * provided image will have the pixelFormat this class was constructed with. Use getDirectMat() to
138   * grab the image.
139   *
140   * @param timeout Retrieval timeout in seconds.
141   * @return Frame time, or 0 on error (call GetError() to obtain the error message); the frame time
142   *     is in 1 us increments.
143   */
144  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CompareObjectsWithEquals")
145  public long grabFrameDirect(double timeout) {
146    m_frame.setInfo(0, 0, 0, m_pixelFormat);
147    long rv =
148        CameraServerJNI.grabRawSinkFrameTimeout(m_handle, m_frame, m_frame.getNativeObj(), timeout);
149    if (rv <= 0) {
150      return rv;
151    }
152
153    if (m_frame.getData() != m_origByteBuffer
154        || m_width != m_frame.getWidth()
155        || m_height != m_frame.getHeight()
156        || m_pixelFormat != m_frame.getPixelFormat()) {
157      m_origByteBuffer = m_frame.getData();
158      m_height = m_frame.getHeight();
159      m_width = m_frame.getWidth();
160      m_pixelFormat = m_frame.getPixelFormat();
161      if (m_frame.getStride() == 0) {
162        m_tmpMat =
163            new Mat(
164                m_frame.getHeight(),
165                m_frame.getWidth(),
166                getCVFormat(m_pixelFormat),
167                m_origByteBuffer);
168      } else {
169        m_tmpMat =
170            new Mat(
171                m_frame.getHeight(),
172                m_frame.getWidth(),
173                getCVFormat(m_pixelFormat),
174                m_origByteBuffer,
175                m_frame.getStride());
176      }
177    }
178    return rv;
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Wait for the next frame and store the image. May block forever. The provided image will have
183   * the pixelFormat this class was constructed with. Use getDirectMat() to grab the image.
184   *
185   * @return Frame time, or 0 on error (call GetError() to obtain the error message); the frame time
186   *     is in 1 us increments.
187   */
188  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CompareObjectsWithEquals")
189  public long grabFrameNoTimeoutDirect() {
190    m_frame.setInfo(0, 0, 0, m_pixelFormat);
191    long rv = CameraServerJNI.grabRawSinkFrame(m_handle, m_frame, m_frame.getNativeObj());
192    if (rv <= 0) {
193      return rv;
194    }
195
196    if (m_frame.getData() != m_origByteBuffer
197        || m_width != m_frame.getWidth()
198        || m_height != m_frame.getHeight()
199        || m_pixelFormat != m_frame.getPixelFormat()) {
200      m_origByteBuffer = m_frame.getData();
201      m_height = m_frame.getHeight();
202      m_width = m_frame.getWidth();
203      m_pixelFormat = m_frame.getPixelFormat();
204      if (m_frame.getStride() == 0) {
205        m_tmpMat =
206            new Mat(
207                m_frame.getHeight(),
208                m_frame.getWidth(),
209                getCVFormat(m_pixelFormat),
210                m_origByteBuffer);
211      } else {
212        m_tmpMat =
213            new Mat(
214                m_frame.getHeight(),
215                m_frame.getWidth(),
216                getCVFormat(m_pixelFormat),
217                m_origByteBuffer,
218                m_frame.getStride());
219      }
220    }
221    return rv;
222  }
223}
